questions.question: Take the umbrella with you in case it ........................
questions.description: In subordinate clauses we often use a present tense to refer to future.

questions.question: The first time I ............................. there was last year.
questions.description: We use the simple past to simply state when something happened.

questions.question: This is the village where I was ..........................
questions.description: Where means the same as in which.

questions.question: She ............................... a couple of months ago.
questions.description: We cannot use the present perfect tense with a past time expression.

questions.question: This is the man whom we met ..........................
questions.description: The relative pronoun serves as the subject or object of the relative clause. Hence we do not need another subject or object in the relative clause.

questions.question: I have warned you a ............................. not to do it.
I don't think ................................ she is interested in coming.
questions.description: That can introduce a noun clause. The conjunction so..that is mainly used to indicate the purpose.

questions.question: She has got ............................. hair.
questions.description: Hair is uncountable. It cannot be used with the article a.

questions.question: ................................... the cold she insisted on going out.
questions.description: Despite or in spite of is possible here.

questions.question: ................................ she arrives, give her this message.
questions.description: Before a clause we use in case.

questions.question: I haven't seen him since .............................
questions.description: There is no preposition or article before expressions like last week.

questions.question: He ................................ school at the age of twelve.
questions.description: We cannot use the present perfect tense with time expressions referring to the past.
